column4: that's the warty kernel - did you change your sources to point at hoary /
Yes, I certainly did.
have you rebooted since the dist-upgrade? what does `uname -r ` return?
One momemt...
2.6.8.1-3-powerpc
And yes, I've rebooted.
very odd if you have hoary - what does ` cat /etc/issue ` say?
Ubuntu 5.04 Hoary Hedgehog \n \l
it will run, but take a while to start
It's running...
Firefox isn't running yet, I guess it's starting...
It runs on my pentium 200mmx, 64MB RAM - but it takes a long while to start
a quick graphical browser is "dillo" - but it doesn't do javascript, frames etc
Firefox is just now *barely* getting started...
I've never heard of dillo; think I'll try it.
dillo is quite nice, but somewhat limited - good for searching on google, locl files, simple web pages etc
it *is* fast though
Oh yeah, I've gotta try it.  There's *no way* I'm going to be using Gnome on this old Mac.
use xfce4 or something really light like icewm or one of the *box window managers
How do I find out what to install/remove?
I understand I'm going to need fluxbox or something?
xfce4 would probably run OK - or fluxbox, yes
was that you?
briefly a while ago, yeah
